title: Health Care Up on UnitedHealth, Johnson & Johnson Earnings Views — Health Care Roundup
text:
Health-care companies rose after two health care giants boosted their earnings projections.

UnitedHealth Group, the largest U.S. health insurer by plan enrollees, increased its earnings forecast for the year after stronger-than-expected third-quarter sales growth. Johnson & Johnson shares rose after the health-care conglomerate, which has been under pressure because of a variety of lawsuits stemming from the opioid crisis and otherwise, said operating earnings would come in ahead of prior expectations for the third quarter.

SmileDirectClub recouped some of Monday's losses, which saw shares close more than 50% below their September IPO price after legislation was signed in California that could make it tougher for the state's residents to buy from the company.
